events.message: The policyholder reported an auto accident involving their vehicle striking a guardrail on May 1, resulting in moderate front-end damage.
Claim was categorised under Auto Accident following the initial review of the accident description and vehicle damage.
An insurance agent was assigned to the claim to assist the policyholder with the claim process and next steps.
The claim was officially acknowledged and the policyholder was informed that the investigation process would commence promptly.
The insurance company requested additional documents including the police report, repair estimates, and photos of the vehicle damage.
The policyholder submitted all requested documents, including detailed images of the damaged vehicle and an official police report.
The claim investigation started to verify the details of the vehicle collision and assess liability and damage extent.
Investigation was completed confirming the policyholder was not at fault and the extent of damage was covered under the policy terms.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover the estimated repair costs of the vehicle in accordance with the assessment.
The policyholder provided positive feedback expressing satisfaction with the clarity and handling of the settlement process.
The claim was formally approved by the insurance company authorizing the payout for vehicle repairs.
Payment was issued to the policyholder's designated account as per the approved settlement amount for the car damage.
The insurance claim was closed following payment issuance and confirmation of repair completion by the policyholder.
All claim documents and communications were archived securely for future reference and regulatory compliance.
